title:
How large was the range (in % terms) for Walmart Inc. (WMT)'s fiscal year 2026 adjusted EPS guidance for Q4 2025, Q1 2026, Q2 2026, and Q3 2026?
 
 Format answer as: "Q[X] [YEAR]: $[X.XX] (low) to $[X.XX] (high), [X.XX]% of midpoint". Add line breaks for each period, and round the EPS figure and % to two decimal places.
description:
First, identify Walmart’s FY 2026 adjusted EPS guidance range for each of the listed quarters:
 The Q4 2025 range is from $2.50 to $2.60
 The Q1 2026 range is from $2.50 to $2.60
 The Q2 2026 range is from $2.52 to $2.62
 The Q3 2026 range is from $2.58 to $2.63
 
 Then, find the % of midpoint for each quarter by first subtracting the high by the low, then dividing that difference by the total of the high plus the low divided by 2, shown here: (high − low) / [(high + low)/2]
 - Q4 2025: (2.60 − 2.50)/2.55 = 3.92%.
 - Q1 2026: (2.60 − 2.50)/2.55 = 3.92%.
 - Q2 2026: (2.62 − 2.52)/2.57 = 3.89%.
 - Q3 2026: (2.63 − 2.58)/2.605 = 1.92%.
 
 Finally, list the ranges and as a percent of the midpoint, rounded to 2 decimal places:
 - Q4 2025: $2.50 (low) to $2.60 (high), 3.92% of midpoint
 - Q1 2026: $2.50 (low) to $2.60 (high), 3.92% of midpoint
 - Q2 2026: $2.52 (low) to $2.62 (high), 3.89% of midpoint
 - Q3 2026: $2.58 (low) to $2.63 (high), 1.92% of midpoint
answer:
Q4 2025: $2.50 (low) to $2.60 (high), 3.92% of midpoint
 Q1 2026: $2.50 (low) to $2.60 (high), 3.92% of midpoint
 Q2 2026: $2.52 (low) to $2.62 (high), 3.89% of midpoint
 Q3 2026: $2.58 (low) to $2.63 (high), 1.92% of midpoint

rubric.criteria: All answers follow the correct format of "Q[X] [YEAR]: $[X.XX] (low) to $[X.XX] (high), [X.XX]% of midpoint"
All answers follow the correct format with line breaks for each period
All answers follow the correct format with rounding to two decimal places
